text:
Aww Yeah! We're finally bringing you
a much requested English lesson
with The Hunger Games.
So I absolutely loved these books.

I believe the first one was actually the first book
I ever read in under 24 hours.
I was just so addicted to this story.

and then I fell in love with it again
when they brought out the movies

with Jennifer Lawrence's superb performance
as Katniss Everdeen.
So, if you've watched this movie series already,

then you know what an amazing story it is,
and what great dialogues it has for learning English.

And if you haven't seen it before,
well, this will be the perfect start for you,

because we've chosen a scene from early in
the first movie to not spoil anything for you.
By the way, if you're new here every week we make fun lessons just like this one with your favorite movies,

series, songs, and more, so that you can
understand fast-speaking natives
without getting lost without,

without missing the jokes
and without subtitles.

Like Aram, who says that our lessons are like
like a miracle for learning English.

If you want to make learning English
feel effortless too,
all you have to do is hit that subscribe button,

and the bell down below, so you
don't miss any of our new lessons.
Now, let's head over to Panem!

Hey! Do you want to improve your vocabulary,
and master American pronunciation

so that you can confidently understand
fast-speaking natives?

Well, we've got a fun and powerful way
for you to do it
with our Fluent with Friends course.

This course will take you on an adventure
learning English with the TV series Friends,

which is highly regarded not only as
one of the best TV series of all time,
but, also one of the best to learn English with.
Every week, you get PDF Power Lessons,

vocabulary memorization software,
and so much more.
Plus, you will never be alone in your learning

because you'll also get access to
our global community of learners
from all over the world, the Fluency Circle.
The best part is: you can try that all for FREE right now
now with our 3-part Masterclass.

All you have to do is click up here, or down 
in the description below to learn more and sign up.

And we're really looking forward
to meeting you inside.

Hey again! Would you like us to make
more lessons with The Hunger Games?

Well, you can let us know by
hitting that like button down below.

And, if you enjoy the Hunger Games,
then, you probably will really like

all of our lessons with Harry Potter as well, 
which you can find in this playlist
by clicking up here or down in the description below.
